Prohibition.definition: an extraordinary writ issued by a higher court commanding an inferior court to keep within its proper jurisdiction

1 a.definition: an extraordinary writ issued by a higher court commanding an inferior court to keep within its proper jurisdiction (as by ceasing a prosecution)

sub_terms.b: an order to refrain or stop

2 a.definition: something (as a law) that prohibits a certain act or procedure

sub_terms.b: the period from 1920 to 1933 in the U.S. when the manufacture, transportation, and sale of alcoholic liquors was prohibited by the Eighteenth Amendment to the U.S. Constitution
